result.execSummary:
The defendant Wesley R Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Wesley R Weaver was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Wesley R Weaver is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Wesley R Weaver was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Wesley R Weaver was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

cover letter from Attorney K. Schmidt with Order Amended JOC
to return Exhibit 1 to the proffering party.

9:13 Defendant Wesley R Weaver in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court opens without presence of jury. Attorney Schmidt has filed motions in limine. Parties stipulate that Tammy Sparks has 4 criminal convictions. Court grants sequestration after voir dire. Officer may be allowed to stay in courtroom. Victim will be allowed to remain in courtroom after he testifies. Parties stipulate that defendant has 8 criminal convictions. Court puts on record discussions yesterday regarding Assistant DA Nicholas Grode. Attorney Zell will not be prosecuting the case. Stipulation was filed regarding this. Jury instruction 765 is discussed. Court will not allow instruction. Attorney Zell states he is withdrawing that State's request for a lesser included. 
9:34 Jurors are brought into courtroom and are sworn. Twenty jurors are called to box.
9:41 Court reads charges and begins voir dire.
9:48 Attorney Zell does voir dire. 
10:00 Attorney Schmidt does voir dire.
10:04 Strikes are made. Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
10:14 Twelve jurors are sworn.
10:16 Attorney Zell gives opening statement.
10:20 Attorney Schmidt gives opening statement.
10:24 Jury in recess. Attorney Schmidt asks that jury be instructed to not go to the scene during lunch. Court will instruct.
10:25 Court in recess.
10:45 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Victim wishes to be present during all testimony. Attorney Schmidt makes statement why he does not want victim present during other testimony. Court rules that Mr. Berkholtz will not be allowed in the courtroom during Tammy Sparks's testimony. But after he testifies, he may remain int he courtroom.
10:53 Jurors are brought into courtroom. Tammi Sparks is sworn a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. He states she is the girlfriend of one of the owner's of Big Al's. On the evening of 3/7/15, she was at Big Al's bar in Wisconsin Rapids. She noticed the door open and the light on in the basement. She told Al the basement door was open and went down to the basement. She saw the defendant in the basement. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. When defendant saw her, he started taking liquor bottles out of his jacket and put them back on the shelves. Al and another man came to the basement. She said she was going to call the police. When she was talking to the police, the defendant tried to get away and he pushed Al and her down. Two other men held on to him. She states she has been convicted of a crime 4 times. 
11:00 Attorney Schmidt cross-examines witness. Exhibit #1 is marked and reviewed with witness. Exhibit is received.
11:17 Attorney Zell redirects.
11:21 Allan Berkholtz is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. He is the co-owner of Big Al's bar. He states on the evening of 3/7/15, he was sitting at the bar with Tammi Sparks and she went outside to smoke. He was told that Tammi was yelling that the basement door was open and she was going down. Testifies that the liquor supply is in the basement and his employees know that the door should be kept locked. He went to the basement and could hear Tammi yelling. He confronted the defendant. No one gave defendant permission to go to the basement. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. The defendant tried to get away and pushed him and Tammi down. Some other patrons at the bar grabbed him and held him  until police arrived. 
11:33 Attorney Schmidt cross-examines witness. 
11:33 Brad Burris is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Zell. He is a police officer with the City of Wisconsin Rapids. On 3/7/15, his was dispatched to Big Al's Bar and was directed to the basement where he saw some men detaining the defendant. After interviewing witnesses, he placed defendant under arrest. 
11:38 Attorney Schmidt cross-examines witness. 
11:42 Attorney Zell redirects. 
11:43 Jury in recess. Previous objection is put on record. Court rules that objection is sustained as heresay. Discussion regarding N.G. being in courtroom and sequestration order. Attorney Schmidt states he does not intend to call N.G. as witness. 
11:55 Court in recess.
1:03 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. State rests. Court questions defendant regarding his right to testify. Defendant states he does wish to testify. 
1:08 Jury is brought into courtroom. State rests. Wesley Weaver is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Schmidt. Testifies as to being at Big Al's Bar on 3/7/15. He had been to multiple bars that night.  Testifies as to how much he had to drink that night. He states he did not know where the restrooms were. He asked someone and they told him in the back and the door on the left. He states a door that was open so he went in. He said Ms. Sparks came down and he asked her how to find the bathroom. He says he did not have anything in his hand. He states that Ms. Sparks left and Mr. Berkholtz came in and started questioning him. Officer Burris arrived and questioned him. He states he has been convicted of a crime 8 times. Exhibit #1 is shown to witness.  

Atty Zell cross examines the witness.  Testifies to his BAC that night and to the establishments he visited.  Describes the entrance to Big Al's Bar and to the basement.  

Defense rests.  Jury recesses 1:37.  

1:54 Court reconvenes.  Atty Zell intends to call a rebutal witness.  Atty Zell moves court to allow Tammy Sparks to remain in the courtroom.  Atty Schmidt does not object.  Court will allow Sparks to remain in the courtroom.  1:57 Jury reconvenes.  Atty Zell calls Officer Brad Burris.  Officer Burris drawers a diagram of the Big Al's location.  Did not take Weaver's jacket into evidence that night.  Diagram is marked as Exhibit 2.  

2:04 Atty Schmidt cross examines the witness.  Has no reason to believe Weaver's jacket was not searched. 

2:07 Atty Schmidt recalls Alan Berkholtz as a witness.  Testifies to the number of doors in the back of the tavern by the alley.  

State rests and the Defense rests.  2:08 Jury recesses.  Court takes up Jury Instructions.  2:19 Court reconvenes and discusses Jury Instructions.  Counsel agree to all.  Court takes up verdict form.  Counsel agrees with verdict form.  Court questions the Defendant regarding Jury Instruction and Verdict Form.  Court recesses at 2:22.  

2:33 Court reconvenes.  Atty Schmidt renews request for instruction on Involuntary Intoxification.  State's objects.  Court's ruling will remain and denies.  2:35 Jury reconvenes.  Court presents Instruction to the Jury.  
2:54 Atty Zell presents closing argument.  
3:04 Atty Schmidt presents closing argument. 
3:31 Atty Zell offers rebutal argument.  
3:37 Final instruction to the jurors and charge. 
3:41 Oaths to Bailiffs Gary Popelka and Tom Sachs.  3:43 Jury proceeds to deliberation.  Court takes up exhibits.  Attys asks that they go back only if asked.  Exhibit 2 was not offered.  That exhibit will remain on the record.  No objection to Exhibit 1 going back if asked for.  3:44 Court recesses.  
4:48 Jury returns from deliberation.  Foreperson - 100 presents the verdict forms to the court.  Court reads the verdicts as follows:

Count 1 - Not Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty

Court polls the jurors.  All answer yes to each count.  4:51 Jury is dismissed.  Atty Schmidt moves to dismiss Count 1.  State moves for motion on judgment based on the jury's verdicts on Count 2 and 3.

Court dismisses Count 1 and enters judgment of Guilty on Count 2 and Count 3.  Atty Schmidt asks to proceed to sentencing.  Atty Zell is prepared to proceed and makes recommendation.  Atty Schmidt addresses sentencing.  Weaver makes a statement.
from Attorney K. Schmidt with objections to State's Requested Jury Instructions
Cover Letter from Atty. Karl A. Schmidt, dated August 14, 2015.

Defendant Wesley R Weaver in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Defendant Wesley R Weaver in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Nolan Plutchak says that the defendant wishes another attorney be appointed.  Court allows new counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Wesley R Weaver in court with attorney Emily M. Nolan-Plutchak.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bradley Burris sworn in.  Testifies he is an officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department.  Testifies he responded to report of male subject taking liquor bottles from the basement of a tavern.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  Testifies to discussion with witness reporting incident. Testifies to discussion with defendant. Testifies the incident took place in Wood County.  
Cross by Attorney Nolan-Plutchak.  Testified the defendant was intoxicated during the incident.  There were no signs of forced entry into the basement.  
Court finds probable cause.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
